title: Typeface: a film by Justine Nagan
content:
[http://typeface.kartemquin.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081021110824/http:/typeface.kartemquin.com/ "http://typeface.kartemquin.com/")

I don’t think there are previous posts about this on Typophile... Design Observer posted a link today.

The [filmmakers](http://web.archive.org/web/20081021110824/http:/typeface.kartemquin.com/filmmakers) need funding, too. Make a donation [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081021110824/http:/typeface.kartemquin.com/contact).

 [‹ Joanna - Where is it used?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081021110824/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44681 "Go to previous forum topic") [May Metal Type News ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081021110824/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44875 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ricardo Cordoba

comments.content: The Hamilton Type Museum is a really cool place. I visited it a couple of years ago.

Looking forward to this. I met some of the people working on it at a film festival in North Carolina a few weeks ago. It’s the same production company that made <cite>Hoop Dreams</cite> and an excellent new doc about the death penalty called <cite>At the Death House Door</cite>.
